description:
A new season of Fortnite means it's time to refresh the loot pool, and the fact that this new season is Simpsons-flavored means we're getting more of an overhaul than usual. It's similar to the situation back in May when Star Wars season replaced all the Fortnite guns with Star Wars blasters, but since The Simpsons is a sitcom and not a movie franchise about wars, Epic is going about things a little differently, by replacing most of the health and shield items with Simpsons food and drinks, while unvaulting a bunch of Fortnite weapons that have not been in the Battle Royale loot pool in a while.

But there are at least a couple of Simpsons-themed weapons, even so. To start the season, we'll have the Mr. Blasty revolver, with an exotic variant that drops from the roaming Krusty the Clown boss N
title: Fortnite - New Weapons In The Simpsons Season

description:
Fortnite's Simpsons takeover is now underway, and so for the next month or so, we'll be duking it out in Springfield and making use of a number of new Simpsons-themed items to help survive against our foes. But no collab takeover is truly complete without cosmetics, and Fortnite is adding tons of Simpsons skins and accessories both in the item shop and via the new Simpsons battle pass.

The Simpsons pass is a relatively short one, with about 70 tiers of rewards vs the usual 200 in the linear part of the pass--as has been the case with all previous mini-seasons. The Simpsons pass includes five skins--Homer, Marge, Ned Flanders, Blinky Fishstick, and Springfielder Peely--each of which has substantial style options, along with accompanying sets of pickaxes, gliders, emotes, and so on. The new Peely is the bonus skin that'll become available starting November
title: Fortnite Battle Pass For Simpsons Season: All Skins And Other Rewards

description:
Fortnite's Simpsons season is finally here after many months of rumors, and in some ways, it's a lot more involved than previous mini-seasons. That's because it's the first of them to take place on a completely new and original island. While the other November mini-seasons took place on updated versions of old maps, and Star Wars season just added Star Wars places to the Battle Royale map, Simpsons season is introducing a totally new, cel-shaded island based on Springfield and various iconic locations from the series for us to fight over in November.

At least one sacrifice was made to make this map happen. This island is a little bit smaller than the current Battle Royale map, and as a result, it uses a smaller player cap than usual at 80 players instead of 100. But that's not necessarily the worst thing, as the smaller island should mean faster and more excit
title: Fortnite Simpsons Map: Full Springfield Map And All Named Locations

description:
The day has finally arrived--after months and months of leaks and rumors, Fortnite's Simpsons season launches today. Just not quite yet, because Fortnite is offline for maintenance following the "Welcome, Our Alien Overlords" event, during which players were treated to a Simpsons short film that explained how they ended up being a part of the Fortnite omniverse.

As is standard operating procedure for Epic, Fortnite goes offline when it's time for a major update. While this usually happens during the middle of the night on a weekday, this season launch is a special event, and as such, it'll kick off on a Saturday evening. That's why it's offline for maintenance now--Epic wants the launch of Fortnite x Simpsons to arrive during primetime on a Saturday night.
title: Fortnite Is Down: When Will Fortnite Servers Be Online For Simpsons Season?
